actions.in_committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Banking and Financial Services. H. Rept. 106-983.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 580.

official_title: To amend the Federal Reserve Act to require the payment of interest on reserves maintained at Federal reserve banks by insured depository institutions, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Bank Reserves Modernization Act of 2000 - Amends the Federal Reserve Act to declare that depository institution balances maintained at a Federal reserve bank may receive earnings to be paid by the Federal reserve bank at least once each calendar quarter. Limits the rate to the general level of short-term interest rates.Authorizes the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to prescribe implementing regulations.Requires the Federal reserve banks to transfer certain surplus funds into the general fund of the Treasury to cover the net cost of such interest payments for FY 2001 through 2005. Prohibits a Federal reserve bank from replenishing its surplus fund by the amount of any such transfer.

titles.title: To amend the Federal Reserve Act to require the payment of interest on reserves maintained at Federal reserve banks by insured depository institutions, and for other purposes.
